intro: Machaeranthera correllii, commonly known as the Texas tansy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. Machaeranthera correllii is known for its aromatic foliage and is often used in traditional herbal practices.
